title: 'Care home staff set up dementia fight club then jeered as sufferers brawled'
text:
These mugshots show (from left) Tonacia Tyson, Marilyn McKey and Taneshia Jordan, who are accused of setting up a dementia patients’ fight club at the care home where they worked

A trio of care home workers set up a dementia fight club then jeered as elderly sufferers brawled with each other, police say.

Marilyn McKey, 32, Tonacia Tyson, 20, and Taneshia Jordan, 26, were all charged with assault on Friday over claims they set up a fighting ring at the Danby House center in Winston-Salem, North Carolina.

All three women stand accused of watching two vulnerable female residents, named in court papers as resident eight and resident nine, fight without trying to intervene and stop.

They are said to have stood by as the women fell onto a bed and resident nine continued to slap resident eight.

A video obtained by police shows resident eight yelling ‘Let go, help me, help me, let go.’

She is said to have been told told ‘Stop screaming, bitch’ by one of the three women paid to care for her.

As resident nine choked resident eight, a voice can be hard saying ‘Punch her in the face.’

The Chernobyl residents who refused to leave against all government and safety advice

One of the carers can be heard demanding that the brawl be filmed, shortly before one told resident eight she was making resident nine ‘turn red.’

The fight finished moments later when a supervisor came into the room and stopped the row, without asking what had happened.

Jordan is further accused of filming that brawl and actively encouraging the women’s violent clash.

The abuse took place at the Danby Care Home in Winston, Salem, with the facility now barred from accepting further residents until multiple systemic failures are addressed (Picture: Google Maps)

She also faces allegations of watching McKey allegedly shove another dementia sufferer into a room without intervening.

McKey is said to have filmed that incident.

Tyson is also accused of brandishing her camera phone during that alleged attack by McKey, but making no attempt to stop her or report what happened afterwards.

All three women were fired in June when the allegations first emerged, the Winston-Salem Journal reported.

The North Carolina Department of Health and Human Services was so concerned by the allegations it has now barred Danby House from admitting new residents.

Staff at the assisted-living and memory-care facility reportedly worked there with no formal training, and regularly denied patients their prescription medication.

All three women are currently free on bail ahead of their next court appearance, a date for which is yet to be set.
description: A trio of care home workers reportedly made two frightened women with dementia fight and screamed encouragement as the brawl unfolded
